isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - Meritor Transfer Cases MTC-4208, -4210, and -4213 - Disassembly - Front Input Shaft, Input Shaft Bearing Cage and Oil Pump

svcproc.title: Front Input Shaft, Input Shaft Bearing Cage and Oil Pump

step1.para: Support the front input shaft and bearing cage assembly at the workbench (Figure 25).

figure.caption: Figure 25. Support Front Input Shaft and Bearing Cage Assembly

step1.para: Use a yoke puller to remove the front input yoke (Figure 26).
Lift the front input bearing cage and oil pump assembly off the input shaft (Figure 27).

figure.caption: Figure 27. Lift Front Input Bearing Cage and Oil Pump Assembly

step1.para: Remove the spiral snap ring that retains the small helical gear on the input shaft. Lift the small helical gear off the shaft (Figure 28).
Remove the pump from the input-bearing cage to service the front input shaft tapered roller bearing cone and cup.
Remove the six bolts retaining the oil pump to the input-bearing cage.
Mark the position of the pump to the cage for reassembly (Figure 29).
Match the pump oil inlet to the cage oil inlet. Match the chamfered relief port in the oil pump with the relief valve and spring assembly in the cage.
Replace the bearing cone and cup as necessary.
Inspect the pump inner rotor in the spline area for cracks or other damage. The entire pump must be replaced if the pump or inner gear rotor is damaged in any way.
